channel.title: SlideShows of the Day
channel.description: SlideShare feed for SlideShows of the Day

item.title: Tips for Delivering an Elevator Pitch
item.description: The elevator door opens. And there stands your ideal investor. It’s the chance of a lifetime. But that chance only lasts as long as the elevator ride - you have less than a minute to make an impression. Hopefully, you’ve got a well-crafted elevator pitch ready to give. The elevator pitch is not the hurried presentation of a full-blown business plan. It’s an introduction, an overview and a pitch - and a short one at that - meant to capture the attention of a potential investor. Of course, an elevator ride is a short one. Guides for elevator speeches that say you have one minute surely overestimate the amount of time it takes for an elevator to move from floor to floor. Of course, an elevator speech isn’t restricted to elevators. Rather, it comes in handy for any occasion where a concise presentation is appropriate. When crafting your pitch there are two key things to keep in mind: its content and its form. In other words, it’s not just what you say but how you say it. Here are a 10 tips to keep in mind as you craft and deliver your elevator pitch.
item.content:encoded: The elevator door opens. And there stands your ideal investor. It’s the chance of a lifetime. But that chance only lasts as long as the elevator ride - you have less than a minute to make an impression. Hopefully, you’ve got a well-crafted elevator pitch ready to give. The elevator pitch is not the hurried presentation of a full-blown business plan. It’s an introduction, an overview and a pitch - and a short one at that - meant to capture the attention of a potential investor. Of course, an elevator ride is a short one. Guides for elevator speeches that say you have one minute surely overestimate the amount of time it takes for an elevator to move from floor to floor. Of course, an elevator speech isn’t restricted to elevators. Rather, it comes in handy for any occasion where a concise presentation is appropriate. When crafting your pitch there are two key things to keep in mind: its content and its form. In other words, it’s not just what you say but how you say it. Here are a 10 tips to keep in mind as you craft and deliver your elevator pitch.
item.author: abhishekshah@slideshare.net(abhishekshah)

media:content.media:description:
The elevator door opens. And there stands your ideal investor. It's the chance of a lifetime. But that chance only lasts as long as the elevator ride - you have less than a minute to make an impression. Hopefully, you've got a well-crafted elevator pitch ready to give.
The elevator pitch is not the hurried presentation of a full-blown business plan. It's an introduction, an overview and a pitch - and a short one at that - meant to capture the attention of a potential investor. Of course, an elevator ride is a short one. Guides for elevator speeches that say you have one minute surely overestimate the amount of time it takes for an elevator to move from floor to floor. Of course, an elevator speech isn't restricted to elevators. Rather, it comes in handy for any occasion where a concise presentation is appropriate.
When crafting your pitch there are two key things to keep in mind: its content and its form. In other words, it's not just what you say but how you say it. Here are a 10 tips to keep in mind as you craft and deliver your elevator pitch.
media:content.media:text: The elevator door opens. And there stands your ideal investor. It’s the chance of a lifetime. But that chance only lasts as long as the elevator ride - you have less than a minute to make an impression. Hopefully, you’ve got a well-crafted elevator pitch ready to give. The elevator pitch is not the hurried presentation of a full-blown business plan. It’s an introduction, an overview and a pitch - and a short one at that - meant to capture the attention of a potential investor. Of course, an elevator ride is a short one. Guides for elevator speeches that say you have one minute surely overestimate the amount of time it takes for an elevator to move from floor to floor. Of course, an elevator speech isn’t restricted to elevators. Rather, it comes in handy for any occasion where a concise presentation is appropriate. When crafting your pitch there are two key things to keep in mind: its content and its form. In other words, it’s not just what you say but how you say it. Here are a 10 tips to keep in mind as you craft and deliver your elevator pitch.

item.title: 10 Reasons You Could be a Recruiter
item.description: Often times, those who are successful in recruiting have just "fallen into it". With 40+ years of combined recuriting experience we’ve identified 10 traits that most successful recruiters have in common. In fact, you might have the majority of those traits yourself and if you do - then consider recruiting as a career!
item.content:encoded: Often times, those who are successful in recruiting have just "fallen into it". With 40+ years of combined recuriting experience we’ve identified 10 traits that most successful recruiters have in common. In fact, you might have the majority of those traits yourself and if you do - then consider recruiting as a career!

item.title: Google Tech Talk: Productivity, happiness, and avoiding sudden death
item.description: Video live at: http://youtu.be/UnZlyouz9s8 . Presented Dec 14, 2012 at Google. Here are the links that illustrate the techniques I mention: * notifymenot.com - Turn off your notifications from social networks * bit.ly/mobileoff - Turn off the badges/alerts on your phone * awayfind.com - Receive alerts for just your important emails, and download the full Guide to NOT Checking Email (part of AwayFind’s setup) * snipr.com/makealist - Clear your head, get started with a system * bit.ly/thecriticalpath - Determine what tasks are critical for your major goals * bit.ly/bodyslave - Schedule your day around your energy levels * bit.ly/remarkablenotproductive - Nevermind productivity, be remarkable If you’d like more information or are interested in a similar talk for your organization, drop me a note: jared@awayfind.com. Please follow me on Twitter: @technotheory.

item.title: The Future Of Music
item.description: By identifying the forces at play in the world of music and the behaviors that are driving those forces, one can identify particular patterns that support current trends. By looking forward to what the future of music may encompass, this presentation aims to provide Carhartt, with valuable insight that will help the brand as a whole, cater to the future of urban millenials.
item.content:encoded: By identifying the forces at play in the world of music and the behaviors that are driving those forces, one can identify particular patterns that support current trends. By looking forward to what the future of music may encompass, this presentation aims to provide Carhartt, with valuable insight that will help the brand as a whole, cater to the future of urban millenials.

item.title: Mobile economy report: 2012 stats, predictions and trends
item.description: Mobile is the first order priority device for access, because it’s always with you, always connected. The desktop’s at the office. The tablet’s at the house. The TV’s at the house. You’re generally not watching TV during the day, but the smartphone is always with you. From mobile usage data to trends and latest news, this ebook should get you up to date with all the new things and we’re sure it will convince you it’s time to go mobile. Feel free to use this presentation in your company if you are trying to convince decision makers to invest in mobile or contact us if you need more advice on the first steps.

item.title: Mindful Eating for Mere Mortals
item.description: Being in control of How we eat is a super habit, that can save us a lot of extra pounds, and help us stay focused during periods of Stress. Mindful Eating, although it might helpful to some, may not be the easiest start for most of us. Find out an easier way to start taking control of How you eat.

Mindful Eating, although it might helpful to some, may not be the easiest start for most of us. Find out an easier way to start taking control of How you eat.
